commit_message:
Disabled field in computehost

- The idea is to enable operator to reserve a non reservable node and
  perform tests
- Only operator/admin should be able to reserve such nodes
- Polling monitor should not automatically make the node reservable
  if the 'disabled' flag is True

Set disabled field True for a host
`openstack reservation host set <host_id/name> --extra disabled=True`

Set disabled field False for a host
`openstack reservation host set <host_id/name> --extra disabled`

WIP: Setting disabled field works as desired (only admin can set/unset)
Creating lease on a disabled=True node doesn't work as desired
  (any project and user can reserve such node)
Expected behaviour: Only admins/admin project should be able
  to create lease on such nodes

Looks like using context policy.enforce does not work if an explicit
  policy is not defined.
Do we need to have an endpoint to define a policy? Not sure if we can
  check in `_matching_hosts` is a user is admin or from admi$

Change-Id: I1496b68436bb434ac2c34343564ce8e149ccf284

commit_message:
Add feature to check if SNAT disabled before exposing tenant networks

If SNAT on the router is enabled, then the subnet is reachable
from the outside, but all new sessions created from within the subnet
will be SNAT-ed. So those sessions will use the external IP of the router.
For example whitelisting specific tenant ips would not be possible.

With SNAT disabled, the neutron router will act as a normal gateway, and
sessions created from within a tenant vm will be sent from the real ip.

Closes-Bug: #2052292
Change-Id: Ib97065fb2fcca069195278fea804256370d21816

commit_message:
Fix: FC partial target scan

When fetching the target value (T in HCTL) for the storage HBAs,
we use the /sys/class/fc_transport path to find available targets.
However, this path only contains targets that already have a LUN
attached from, to the host.

Scenario:
If we have 2 controllers on the backend side with 4 target HBAs each (total 8).
For the first LUN mapping from controller1, we will do a wildcard
scan and find the 4 targets from controller1 which will get
populated in the /fc_transport path.
If we try mapping a LUN from controller2, we try to find targets in the
fc_transport path but the path only contains targets from controller1 so
we will not be able to discover the LUN from controller2 and fail with
NoFibreChannelVolumeDeviceFound exception.

Solution:
In each rescan attempt, we will first search for targets in the
fc_transport path: "/sys/class/fc_transport/target<host>*".
If the target in not found then we will search in the fc_remote_ports
path: "/sys/class/fc_remote_ports/rport-<host>*"

If a [c,t,l] combination is found from either path, we add it to
the list of ctls we later use it for scanning.

This way, we don't alter the current "working" mechanism of scanning
but also add an additional way of discovering targets and improving
the scan to avoid failure scenarios in each rescan attempt.

Closes-Bug: #2051237
Change-Id: Ia74b0fc24e0cf92453e65d15b4a76e565ed04d16
(cherry picked from commit f2154eedf0d04ef960dbf1df7fb87f74f6a35dbf)

commit_message:
Allow configure of OPENSTACK_INSTANCE_RETRIEVE_IP_ADDRESSES

If network calls to retrieve ports and floating IPs take too long,
then the project > instances page cannot be loaded. This config
allows disabling the network calls when loading the page with
minor side-effects, as a workaround to avoid downtime while other
performance optimizations can be done on the side to allow
the page the load so the workaround is no longer needed.

Closes-bug: #2051003
Related-bug: #2045168

commit_message:
Bugfix: Clean up trusts for all deleted clusters

Cluster conductor creates trusts for all drivers, but does not clean
them up. The Heat driver has previously performed this action.

This change moves the lifecycle of trust and certificate creation
to the Conductor, so drivers do not need to clean up resources they
didn't create.

commit_message:
neutron: do not error if no cleaning/provisioning on launch

In the early days of the neutron network interface, we had a hard
launch failure added to prevent ironic.conf from having a neutron
network configuration which was not valid when the neutron network
interface was in use.

But as time has moved on, these settings became node-settable,
and ironic configuration largely became mutable as well, so they
can always be added after the process has been launched.

But we kept the error being returned. Which doesn't make sense
now that it can always be back-filled into a working state
or just entirely be "user supplied" via the API by an appropriate
user.

Closes-Bug: 2054728
Change-Id: I33e76929ca9bf7869b3b4ef4d6501e692cf0a922

Disable exposing remote_ips, when only the lrp prefix is sufficient

This also requires to use redist kernel in FRR, so there is a change
here which allows to define the default redistribute options in the FRR
template.

can be removed, as the only difference was the redist kernel, instead of
redist connected.

commit_message:
Ensure that haproxy spawned by the metadata agents is active

In both neutron-metadata and neutron-ovn-metadata agents we should
ensure that haproxy service spawned for network/router is actually
active before moving on.
This patch adds that check and this is similar to what was already
implemented some time ago for the dnsmasq process spawned by the dhcp
agent.

Fix: include missing docker log-opts in config

The default docker config options, which specify the ``log-opts`` under
``roles/docker/vars/main.yml``, were not included in the
``docker_config`` combinations when the docker role was extracted from
the baremetal role in the Zed release. This means that
``docker_log_max_file`` and ``docker_log_max_size`` are not written into
the docker daemon.json.

The var name needs to be changed, as it can't be recursively defined
within the ``docker_config`` definition under
``roles/docker/tasks/config.yml`.

commit_message:
Enable healthcheck middleware

The healthcheck middleware from oslo.middleware library is now commonly
enabled in OpenStack services, for service healthcheck (often used by
load balancers such as haproxy). This enables the middleware so that
operators can use the healthcheck endpoint more easily. This also
replaces the oslo.middleware config entry point by more specific sub
entry points, to avoid rendering options from unused middlewares such
as sizelimit.

commit_message:
Object-server: add periodic greenthread yielding during file read.

Currently, when object-server serves GET request and DiskFile
reader iterate over disk file chunks, there is no explicit
eventlet sleep called. When network outpace the slow disk IO,
it's possible one large and slow GET request could cause
eventlet hub not to schedule any other green threads for a
long period of time. To improve this, this patch add a
configurable sleep parameter into DiskFile reader, which
is 'cooperative_period' with a default value of 0 (disabled).

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I80b04bad0601b6cd6caef35498f89d4ba70a4fd4

commit_message:
proxy: don't use recoverable_node_timeout with x-newest

Object GET requests with a truthy X-Newest header are not resumed if a
backend request times out. The GetOrHeadHandler therefore uses the
regular node_timeout when waiting for a backend connection response,
rather than the possibly shorter recoverable_node_timeout. However,
previously while reading data from a backend response the
recoverable_node_timeout would still be used with X-Newest requests.

This patch simplifies GetOrHeadHandler to never use
recoverable_node_timeout when X-Newest is truthy.

Change-Id: I326278ecb21465f519b281c9f6c2dedbcbb5ff14

commit_message:
Skip the enforcer undefined rule check

That will avoid unnecessary warning messages in the logs. The
role enforcer only loads the following 3 rules:
* _ADMIN_CTX_POLICY = 'context_is_admin'
* _ADVSVC_CTX_POLICY = 'context_is_advsvc'
* _SERVICE_ROLE = 'service_api'

This functionality was implemented in [1]. oslo.policy library
is bumped to version 4.3.0 that contains this patch.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.policy/+/907196

Add feature to specify driver explicitly

Allow ClusterTemplate to explicitly specify a driver to use for creating
Clusters.

This is a duplicate task contained in build-report, however, the same
have more tasks that are not required in centos 7 jobs that run kolla,

executing this one. This is required because the tool that copy the

commit_message:
ipv6-radvd - CentOS Stream 9

Change the default radvd_image to CentOS Stream 9.

Stop using os-net-config, and instead rely on cloud-init
for network configuration. Even with dhcp disabled on
the provisioning network cloud-init correctly configures
the interfaces.

The OpenStack stein release repositories are no longer
used since there is no CentOS 9 Stream build. The Openstack
packages was only required for os-net-config.

With this change CentOS 7 is no longer supported as OS for
the ipv6-radvd instance.

Change-Id: I83da20850dc84ff98a221d5a966968587f180dde

commit_message:
Fixed detection of AES-256-CBC private keys

Between RHEL8 and 9, the format of the private keys have changed, it was
possible to get the encryption algo directly from the headers of the PEM
file, but it's no longer available. We can now get the algorithm with
the asn1parse tool of openssl.

Resolves: rhbz#2252228

Change-Id: I4709b74deab690464b811de0d299c45604dd961d

commit_message:
Replace underscores with hyphens in dns_domain

When creating Neutron networks, the name we use must be able to form a
valid DNS name. For this reason, we should replace underscores with
hyphens when we set the dns_domain property of any Neutron networks.

This changes the format of the string when creating the network spec,
which is used for both createing and updating networks.

Resolves: rhbz#2247835
Change-Id: Iebe93f50f2d3e5b7955f7c5fff67e8ab4f078a87

commit_message:
Configure ansible-galaxy to use caching proxies

This patch ensures we're using first the provided caching proxy, and if
it fails for whatever reason, we'll fallback onto the default
galaxy.ansible.com API endpoint.

Doing so, we should hopefully get a better, stronger way to get
collections in the various CI jobs.

The addition of the "--no-cache" is a workaround. The way ansible-galaxy
cache is implemented is incompatible with the way the proxies are
working: the CI job has a cname-1, while the httpd process knows itself
as cname-2. The mod_substitute used in httpd cannot use httpd variables,
thus it substitute ansible-galaxy server by the cname-2, breaking galaxy
cache for content having more than one page of listed versions (it uses
the servername, thus cname-1, and the JSON holds the full URI, with
fqdn, matchin cname-2).
We're working on a better handling on the proxy side.

Note: the Depends-On will not work, since it's related to an
infrastructure change; it's here only to make sure people are able to
follow the whole story.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/system-config/+/866175
Related-Bug: #1998297
Change-Id: Ibb8b2b77cb56fa9c9568dd878dec128caa6ab256

commit_message:
Extend configurable skippability of neutron calls to project instance detail

The OPENSTACK_INSTANCE_RETRIEVE_IP_ADDRESSES config aids
in envs struggling to load the instance list due to having
too many ports or bad neutron plugin performance. However,
the config does not apply its effect to the instance detail
page, which cannot be loaded due to the neutron calls
taking too long.

This patch extends the config option to the instance
detail page, allowing the same benefit (and side-effects)
of the instance list page.

Related-bug: #2045168
Change-Id: I3e71a208a1c7212e168d63a259f2adddf27dbabf

Fix event handling for LSP and prefer the options.requested-chassis info

Since the requested-chassis superseeds the placement in external_ids
(which is managed by neutron), we should preferable use that instead of the
value set by neutron (which _could_ lag or be wrong in specific scenario's)

commit_message:
Install ironic-inspector in bifrost

Bifrost has moved to use the native in-band inspection support in
Ironic[1]. Some features are missing (such as introspection rules), so
it may still be desirable to use ironic-inspector for these use cases.
It also requires changes to the inspection interface of the ironic nodes
(ironic-inspector -> agent), so it also desirable to support
ironic-inspector for backwards compatability reasons. We should consider
dropping ironic-inspector once the native interface reaches feature
parity.

This will install ironic-inspector into the image, but will still
require configuration in bifrost.yml to use it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/commit/dcbf1d98b92236be7e4b9d89169a66892127e63b

Change-Id: I3cc8455647339c67ba51620d5aff8a3acbf58dab

[CI] Install dependencies for docs target

When tox 'docs' target is called, first it installs the dependencies
(listed in 'deps') in 'installdeps' phase, then it installs murano
(with its requirements) in 'develop-inst' phase. In the latter case
'deps' is not used so that the constraints defined in 'deps' are not
used. This could lead to failures on stable branches when new packages
are released that break the build. To avoid this, the simplest solution
is to pre-install requirements, i.e. add requirements.txt to 'docs' tox
target.

Changes:
  tox.ini

NOTE(elod.illes): branch specific upper constraints file link updated.

Change-Id: I1d80bfc5f9c3fecc8551ffc8592e39f76b671485
(cherry picked from commit 1f211823aa8766075d80694c1c3eb6f8c4a3dedf)

commit_message:
lint: Up-rev hacking

Without up-reving hacking python 3.12 can't be used for pep8/flake8
checks. Also address a few new pyflakes issues that seem reasonable
to enforce:

   E275 missing whitespace after keyword
   H214 Use assertIn/NotIn(A, B) rather than
        assertTrue/False(A in/not in B)
   H211 do not compare types, use assert{Is,IsNot}Instance

Add F811 (redefinition of unused 'function'), as this check makes
client.py fail.

And noqa some longer lines that we're happy to carry.

Change-Id: Ic97698a310ffe7114b668b8c4bc0195f6997bb45

commit_message:
Fix container name already exists handling

The logic for preventing to start a container with the same name
is not working due to a bad match in the grep command. However the whole
logic of checking if the container exists can be replaced by the --replace
argument starting with podman 2.0. For the docker case, I kept the code and fixed the
grep command by replacing `$` with the literal delimeter `:`. A LIST element
is in the format as specified in docker ps --format. E.i.
d3ffda4c1e0e:neutron-haproxy-ovnmeta-3f52da69-6bf0-41d9-8c70-d3113426a602:Up

Closes-Bug: #2035284
Change-Id: I0199eb6a369eb83cdfd4fba5decd388e802ece93

commit_message:
Pass timeout from overcloud deploy command for heat deploy

The timeout specified in [1] for heat_deploy method was
never passed to deploy_without_plan method [2].
This will hugely impact our customers at scale as the
stack_action_timeout is set to 3600 seconds by default and
heat stack would fail.

Try yaml then try json loading if a ConstructorError occurs

If operators are using {{ }} in their nic templates, the yaml loading
fails with an unhashable key due to {{ }} not being valid .yaml format
but apparently is a valid json key.   This regression was induced with
bd45a745da1ef95718a5a6893f510ef02937f1b5 commit.

commit_message:
WIP - Refactoring preflight checks and validations

The goal of this review is to refactor the preflight checks
for undercloud, tripleo and overcloud deploy in order to
centralized all those checks into a common place in tripleo-validations.
The major gain of this approach is:
* allow operators to run preflight checks on demmand, outside of the
  tripleo CLI deploy command with the Validation Framework binary.
* the checks will be logged on the fs and the history could be retrieved
* the checks sometimes overlap existing validations, so converging those will
  avoid duplication.

Change-Id: I165eb65c54a2767b916d947251771b5548cb7071

commit_message:
Add multi-rhel support for Nova services

This change adds support for multi-rhel nova-compute and nova-libvirt handling.
For this, we rely on the user providing the namespaces key in the CIP dict.
If namespaces is defined we will loop over them and assign the Heat params:

ContainerImagePrepare:
  - set:
      [...]
      namespaces: ['quay.io/tripleomastercentos9', 'quay.io/tripleomastercentos8']
      [...]

Heat Param outputs:
  ContainerNovaLibvirtConfigImage: {
       8: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos8/nova-libvirt:current-tripleo",
       9: "quay.io/tripleomastercentos9/nova-libvirt:current-tripleo"
  }

commit_message:
Ensure glance-api services are deployed correctly

This patch adds deploy_steps tasks to catch errors that would
prevent glance-api services from working correctly. The tasks
ensure the deployment fails as early as possible, with an error
message that explains what the user needs to do to correct the
error.

It ensures the GlanceApiInternal service is deployed for roles
that deploy the GlanceApi service. This covers cases where a
deployment is using a custom roles file, and the user overlooked
the release note regarding the need to add the new service when
performing an update.

It also ensures all glance-api services are deployed on the same
network. Allowing the services to be deployed on different networks
would add needless complexity for little gain, so this catches
attempts to customize the ServiceNetMap in a way that would conflict
with that constraint.

Change-Id: I5f88a5938897a516081b7bd9d9972feed157fecd

commit_message:
Make ed25519 deployments work with FIPS

When EnableMysqlAuthEd25519 is used with FIPS, the DB users'
passwords contain binary data. The associated hiera keys hold
base64-encoded values to ease the handling of binary data.

The password part of the database URI has to be encoded with
RFC1738 for oslo.db. Since we can't reuse the base64-encoded
value, use the new <service>PasswordDatabase Heat parameters
to generate the database URI.

Note: we want the <service>PasswordDatabase parameter to hold
the RFC1738-encoded version of the binary password so it can be
stored in a yaml file. In order to prevent Heat's make-url
to encode the password another time, we use a yaql expression
to inject the value of <service>PasswordDatabase into the
generated database URI.

Tested by deploying a standalone, undercloud and HA overcloud
with and without EnableMysqlAuthEd25519.

Closes-Bug: #1960271

commit_message:
Octavia: skip external deploy tasks if no nodes

Under some conditions, octavia environment files might be included in
a command line without any roles with octavia amphora controllers in
the list of services. This causes a problem in the generation of the
octavia inventory. This patch will cause an empty inventory to be
generated so none of the external tasks are run if there are no
octavia components included in the current deployment.

Change-Id: I75e67445dfc78c9525cff3999d3e409c9120e70c

commit_message:
Allow an operator to install IDM without TLS-e

As it is, if an operator installs IPA on all their hosts, keystone
with the LDAP backend will break because it lists a TLS certificate
that isn't available in the keystone container.  This patch allows
any operator to tell THT that IPA is installed and that the volume
should be presented.

Change-Id: I5abf3674ae612c4a6e7fa5072d0adbc5f4c260e0

commit_message:
Set default caching backend in ceilometer

Introduce new parameters "CeilometerEnableCaching"
and "CeilometerCachingBackend" to configure caching in Ceilometer.

This change sets "oslo_cache.dict" as the default caching backend.

Ceilometer requires caching after 69133858e55a81c0fbc104a0e90f3d6d20c8b76f
was introduced which captures project/user name fields by querying
Keystone. With caching enabled, Ceilometer will avoid overwhelming
Keystone api with such requests.

Change-Id: I59c8c142af01189b4d2a399f5c32733dbcc163e5

commit_message:
Only perform IHA scale down taks when necessary

Let's avoid running the crm_node command when there is no
pacemaker_remote service running, otherwise it will error out with:

[root@compute-0 ~]# crm_node -n
error: Could not connect to controller: Connection refused

In addition, let's check if we are running these commands on a compute
node by checking if its hostname is in the
compute_instanceha_short_node_names list to filter out any eventual
composable-ha node running pacemaker_remote.

Resolves: rhbz#2251805
Change-Id: Ie3e69378bfeb6359a0cb14ae3b3fb70874a0df7a

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238

commit_message:
Use puppet-openstack_spec_helper

This change replaces a few core files such as spec_helper by the common
implementation in puppet-openstack_spec_helper, so that we don't need
to maintain the different implementation in this repository. This
allows us to fix the broken library installation in CentOS 9 Stream.

Because of this change, acceptance tests now uses litmus instead of
beaker, following the transition in the Puppet OpenStack project. Note
the acceptance tests are not actually used in CI. We probably want to
add litmus jobs to run these tests but these are left as a future work
now.

Also, fixed the manifests to adapt to a few more lint plugins enabled.
The example manifests are updated, to avoid failure in
the check_absolute_classname lint plugin.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/863187
Change-Id: I43c41103672de99a928807fe69fe3ee8a0274ec7
